content: May I gently bump #11798 on the review queue? It is reducing or removing autoImplicit in about 50 files, which means it's conflict-prone. (I have just merged master for the sixth time in the past two weeks.)
I'm happy to split it into smaller chunks (separate directories or fewer files). That said, in the past people complained about me submitting too small PRs...
54 files is quite a lot to review all at once
A reasonable split might be category theory vs not
I'll take a look at it in it's current state

Eric Wieser said:

54 files is quite a lot to review all at once

Fair enough, my next PRs will be smaller!

Thanks for the careful comments @Kyle Miller @Richard Osborn ; I have addressed all of them.

Unfortunately, my login to github is flaky right now... can somebody bors r+ it, please?
I think this PR was fine (it was 15 minutes of review time), but I wouldn't have said no to smaller thematic chunks of course.
My comment was "this is too big for me to review quickly now"; but it was definitely within the range of acceptable lengths
I'm on an airplane right now, and I can't get #11798 to load far enough to merge. Could someone else try?
It looks like the build is failing at the moment, unfortunately.
